solution_line_template: First figure out how many hours each worker works per month by multiplying the number of days they work by the number of hours a day they work: {days_per_month} days * {hours_per_day} hours/day = <<{days_per_month}*{hours_per_day}={hours_per_worker_per_month}>>{hours_per_worker_per_month} hours

Then calculate how much one warehouse worker makes per month by multiplying their hourly rate by the number of hours they work: {hours_per_worker_per_month} hours * ${warehouse_worker_wage}/hour = $<<{hours_per_worker_per_month}*{warehouse_worker_wage}={wage_per_warehouse_worker}>>{wage_per_warehouse_worker}

Then multiply that number by {num_warehouse_workers} to find out how much all the warehouse workers make: ${wage_per_warehouse_worker}/worker * {num_warehouse_workers} workers = $<<{wage_per_warehouse_worker}*{num_warehouse_workers}={total_warehouse_wages}>>{total_warehouse_wages}

Now multiply the hours each manager works (also {hours_per_worker_per_month}) by their hourly wage to find out how much one manager makes per month: {hours_per_worker_per_month} hours * ${manager_wage}/hour = $<<{hours_per_worker_per_month}*{manager_wage}={wage_per_manager}>>{wage_per_manager}

Now multiply one manager's wages by the number of managers (2) to find their total wage amount: ${wage_per_manager}/manager * {num_managers} managers = $<<{wage_per_manager}*{num_managers}={total_manager_wages}>>{total_manager_wages}

Now add the wages for the managers and the workers to find the total cost of the wages: ${total_manager_wages} + ${total_warehouse_wages} = $<<{total_manager_wages}+{total_warehouse_wages}={total_wages}>>{total_wages}
Now multiply the total wage bill by 10% to find how much the FICA taxes are: ${total_wages} * {fica_tax_rate} = $<<{total_wages}*{fica_tax_rate}={fica_taxes}>>{fica_taxes}
Now add the total wage bill to the total tax amount to find the grand total: ${fica_taxes} + ${total_wages} = $<<{fica_taxes}+{total_wages}={grand_total}>>{grand_total}
